Class Deck

  • java.lang.Object
    • Deck

  • public class Deck
extends java.lang.Object
    Keyan Pishdadian 2014, code belongs to Jackie Horton 2014 This class creates a "deck" of cards by constructing an arrayList with 52 Card objects, methods are provided for shuffling, dealing, and removing cards.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Deck()
      Constructor for the deck, calls the freshDeck() method.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int cardsRemaining()
      Finds the size of the ArrayList, which signifies the number of elements left in the "deck".
      Card dealCard()
      Method removes the card in the first position of the ArrayList.
      void freshDeck()
      Creates the 52 Card object ArrayList with nested loops.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the ArrayList has anymore elements remaining.
      void shuffle()
      Randomizes the order of Card objects in the ArrayList.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Deck

        public Deck()
        Constructor for the deck, calls the freshDeck() method.

    • Method Detail

      • freshDeck

        public void freshDeck()
        Creates the 52 Card object ArrayList with nested loops. The cards are in order and must be randomized before use.

      • dealCard

        public Card dealCard()
        Method removes the card in the first position of the ArrayList.
        Returns:
        Card object in the first position of the ArrayList.

      • cardsRemaining

        public int cardsRemaining()
        Finds the size of the ArrayList, which signifies the number of elements left in the "deck".
        Returns:
        integer size of the ArrayList.

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle()
        Randomizes the order of Card objects in the ArrayList.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks if the ArrayList has anymore elements remaining.
        Returns:
        true if there are no more elements in the ArrayList false if there are more elements
